content.description: Sit start on a smooth, flat ledge. Move straight up on good holds and topout. The crux is the first move.
content.location: To the left of the eastern side of the boulder just to the right of the big crack.

content.description: Sit start underneath the spine of the boulder with left hand on a flat, downward sloping incut and right on a large pinch. Move up to a good sloper and along the spine with powerful moves.
content.location: On the far right side of the eastern face.

content.description: start at the left, go under the overhang, then go up the outer face. the crux is getting good holds to pull yourself over the top. there's a rounded corner hold at the right of the top that helps, like when you have your foot on the big bump hold.
content.location: This is at the hidden boulder down the hill.

content.description: Starts matched on the obvious undercling and moves up onto the big ledge above. Tops out above the long crack that extends up from the ledge.
content.location: Center of the eastern side of the boulder.

content.description: To the right side of the eastern face there is a small overhang. Starts with left hand beneath the overhang on a good sidepull and right hand on a small edged crimp just above the overhang (Shared start with Captain). Move left to a crack and take a good triangular hold overhead. These first few moves are the crux with some foot work beneath the small overhang. The crux ends at the good, incut ledge above the traingular hold. You could go directly to the ledge but the extra moves make the most of the overhang, adding difficulty. From that ledge, the climb becomes easier. Moving up and to the right you will find a long, slightly sharp crimp before topping out.
content.location: To the right of the eastern side of the boulder beneath the small overhang.

content.description: Starts with right hand on a low diamond shaped flake (The hold for the heel hook on Captain) and left hand on a crimp out to the left (The edge just to the left of the crimp Captain & Mountain Goat start on). Pumpy first move and the following sequence is the crux. Climb straight up on small ledges, pinches and crimps. Reach the horn like jug at the top of the boulder and topout. Yellow/Gold Line.
content.location: To the far right of the eastern side of the boulder where there is a small overhung section. Starts on the far right side of the overhung section where the bottom of the boulder goes more inward.

content.description: To the right side of the eastern face there is a small overhang. Starts with left hand beneath the overhang on a good sidepull and right hand on a small edged crimp just above the overhang. Take a good, triangular hold overhead and place a heel hook on a low hold to the right. Traverse to the right, on a series of cracks and small ledges until you reach the high jug on the spine of the boulder. Reach the top of the spine and topout.
content.location: Eastern face of the boulder beneath the small overhang. Moves right onto the spine.

content.description: A combination of a few scattered boulders and climbing on the cliff band. Near perfect, flat landing and medium height makes for a great solo spot.
